content:
• Monday, August 1, 2011
  • FOE

    More on Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q2 sales beat expectations, but material costs hit bottom-line...

    More on Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q2 sales beat expectations, but material costs hit bottom-line margins. The company also cut guidance for Q3 due to reduced sales expectations for its conductive metal pastes. Shares -7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • OIS

    Oil States International (NYSE:OIS), a provider of specialty products and services to oil and...

    Oil States International (NYSE:OIS), a provider of specialty products and services to oil and gas companies, is up 2.6% AH after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $820.3M (+38% Y/Y) and $1.34, beating a consensus of $793.8M and $1.19. The company's offshore products backlog stood at $519M as of 6/30, up 25% Q/Q. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • BGC

    More on General Cable (NYSE:BGC): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue, as demand and pricing...

    More on General Cable (NYSE:BGC): Q2 misses on both EPS and revenue, as demand and pricing weakness in its European business unit continues to drag down performance. The company issues mixed guidance for Q3, saying earnings will be below estimates on slightly better revenue. Shares -7.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • FMC

    Chemical manufacturer FMC drops 4.3% AH after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $812.2M...

    Chemical manufacturer FMC drops 4.3% AH after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $812.2M (+9% Y/Y, excluding exited businesses) and $1.52, slightly beating a consensus of $811.5M and $1.51. While 2011 EPS guidance of $5.60-$5.80 is in-line with a consensus of $5.72, Q3 guidance of $1.25-$1.40 is below a consensus of $1.42. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • HLF

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q2 blows away estimates in its eighth-straight quarter of growth....

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q2 blows away estimates in its eighth-straight quarter of growth. Revenues increased +27% Y/Y on solid cash flows, while net income jumped +35% over the same period. The company also raises FY11 guidance, now seeing EPS in the range of $2.97- $3.07. Shares +9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVH

    More on Warnaco (WRC): Q2 estimates beat across the board on a 32% jump in international profit....

    More on Warnaco (WRC): Q2 estimates beat across the board on a 32% jump in international profit. Calvin Klein revenues +19%, driven by strong sales in Latin America and Asia. The company ups its FY11 EPS and revenue guidance. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • GEC

    Openwave Systems (OPWV) misses EPS estimates by a wide shot on higher expenditures and poor...

    Openwave Systems (OPWV) misses EPS estimates by a wide shot on higher expenditures and poor product mix. The company announces plans to restructure its business and to reduce its workforce by 18 - 20% beginning in Q212. Shares -6.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • TXRH

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH) missed estimates after reporting a $0.22 EPS vs consensus $0.21 on...

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH) missed estimates after reporting a $0.22 EPS vs consensus $0.21 on Q2 profit of $16M (+7% Y/Y). The firm lowers guidance for 2011 EPS growth to 5% from a range of 5%-10%, blaming inflationary pressures. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • PAA

    Aside from Medicare-dependent firms (I, II), defense contractors (PAA -1.2%) also have much to...

    Aside from Medicare-dependent firms (I, II), defense contractors (PAA -1.2%) also have much to fear from "devastating" cuts via a debt deal. The Pentagon would take fully 50% of cuts imposed by any triggered second round of $1.2T in cuts, Lazard analyst Michael Lewis warns. LMT -1.7%, RTN -0.9%, NOC -1.5%, GD -0.9%, SAI -2.7%, LLL -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • ANTM

    Health insurance provider Amerigroup (AGP), already hit hard on Friday due to a weak earnings...

    Health insurance provider Amerigroup (AGP), already hit hard on Friday due to a weak earnings report and cuts in Medicaid reimbursements, fell another 12.6% today on fears of significant Medicare cuts. Barclays is lowering its PT on the firm to $63, citing weak earnings and remarks from the company about "rising health care cost trends."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • LCII

    RV components maker Drew Industries (DW -6.4%) takes a hit after its Q2 missed estimates due to...

    RV components maker Drew Industries (DW -6.4%) takes a hit after its Q2 missed estimates due to slower-than-anticipated economic growth and higher material costs. The company reafirms FY11 guidance, but says those figures are "highly subjective" to the health of the U.S. economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • AUXL

    Citi lowers its price target on Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -6.6%) to $22 from $27 saying...

    Citi lowers its price target on Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -6.6%) to $22 from $27 saying expectations on revenue from the firm's Xiaflex are too high. Earlier the firm issued its own downward guidance on FY11 revenue derived from the drug to a range of $45M-$50M from $50M-$60M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • HUM

    The prospect of potential Medicare cuts in a debt ceiling deal pressures hospital and...

    The prospect of potential Medicare cuts in a debt ceiling deal pressures hospital and managed-care stocks, negating Humana's (HUM -2.3%) solid Q2 results. The deal includes preset cuts that kick in if Congress doesn't adopt sufficient savings in a second wave of deficit reduction. Among hospitals: HCA -7.2%, [[UHS] -8.2%. In managed care, HUM and UNH -3.8% slip.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MDT

    On any other day this stock would be trading higher, but not today. Covidien (COV -2.2%) trades...

    On any other day this stock would be trading higher, but not today. Covidien (COV -2.2%) trades lower with the rest of the weak healthcare sector despite announcing its morphine sulfate solution Mallinckrodt - a hospice-related pain drug - has just been approved by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • RDCM

    Radcom (NASDAQ:RDCM) rises 5% after reporting Q2 revenues of $5.9M (+28% Y/Y) on a record level...

    Radcom (NASDAQ:RDCM) rises 5% after reporting Q2 revenues of $5.9M (+28% Y/Y) on a record level of bookings. The firm's non-GAAP net income for the quarter reached $315K or $0.05/share, down from $487K or $0.09/share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +1%) shares gain after Piper Jaffray says its survey points to a "significant...

    Apple (AAPL +1%) shares gain after Piper Jaffray says its survey points to a "significant pent-up demand" for the next iPhone, particularly at Verizon (NYSE:VZ). A delay in the launch of iPhone5 to October would cut Q3 profit, but iPhone market share "could more than double throughout the next round of phone purchases." Also, Canaccord raises its price target to $515 from $510.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • APLP

    Exterran (EXLP +2.9%) shares hold on to gains after declaring an increased Q2 cash distribution...

    Exterran (EXLP +2.9%) shares hold on to gains after declaring an increased Q2 cash distribution on Friday of $0.4825 per limited partner unit, The payment represents a 4% increase Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • IDXG

    PDI (PDII +4.5%) is higher after announcing earlier it signed a two-and-a-half-year,...

    PDI (PDII +4.5%) is higher after announcing earlier it signed a two-and-a-half-year, fee-for-service agreement with an undisclosed pharmaceutical company to market a treatment for knee pain. The agreement is expected to generate $10M in revenues in FY11 and $55M over the life of the contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • JCS

    Network device maker Communications Systems (JCS +2.7%) is trading higher after announcing...

    Network device maker Communications Systems (JCS +2.7%) is trading higher after announcing earlier today it had acquired U.K. networking manufacturer Patapsco Designs for an undisclosed sum. The acquisition adds pseudowire plus a variety of other new ISDN products to the company's portfolio and capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • OSK

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK -2.3%) continue to falter after last week's disappointing FQ3 report....

    Shares of Oshkosh (OSK -2.3%) continue to falter after last week's disappointing FQ3 report. SunTrust Robinson Humphrey lowered its rating to Reduce from Neutral  to add fuel to the fire, but so far Carl Icahn - who owns a 9.5% stake of the firm - has been quiet.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • FXY

    Nikkei reports Japan is gearing up for currency intervention and that the BoJ may take...

    Nikkei reports Japan is gearing up for currency intervention and that the BoJ may take additional monetary easing steps at its meeting later this week. The paper calls the U.S. "open" to the idea. (Registration req'd) FXY -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) gains 3.3% following a Mercury Research report stating the company's...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) gains 3.3% following a Mercury Research report stating the company's notebook graphics processor (GPU) share rose 8.9% in Q2, dispelling fears that AMD's weak Q2 graphics sales were a sign of broader weakness. However, Jeffries cautions that the notebook market's growing focus on low-power solutions will hurt Nvidia's GPU sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • CQB

    Shares of Chiquita (CQB -3.4%) face pressure after a report says the firm may face a lawsuit in...

    Shares of Chiquita (CQB -3.4%) face pressure after a report says the firm may face a lawsuit in Colombia over plantation deaths. The news sours last week's announcement the firm has entered a multi-year strategic agreement with Walt Disney (DIS -1.5%) to bring fresh products to Disney resorts and cruise lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • NVE

    More on NV Energy (NVE -2.2%): shares are down after Q2 earnings dropped 65% due to lower...

    More on NV Energy (NVE -2.2%): shares are down after Q2 earnings dropped 65% due to lower revenue and an energy efficiency adjustment charge that hurt bottom-line margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • PETS

    PetMed Express (PETS +2.8%) trades higher today after its board authorizes an additional $20M...

    PetMed Express (PETS +2.8%) trades higher today after its board authorizes an additional $20M stock repurchase. This is the fourth in a series of repurchases the pet medication supplier has made over the past year, taking advantage of a 40% price decline to buy into weakness in the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +2.8%) posts another gain after Friday's big post-Q2 earnings report...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +2.8%) posts another gain after Friday's big post-Q2 earnings report jump. Jefferies upgrades shares to a Buy from Hold with a $52 price target noting the firm "previously modeled only 5% volume growth in '11-'13," but now sees "double-digit growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • USO

    Crude oil joins the "risk off" rally with a vengeance, its decline accelerating in the last few...

    Crude oil joins the "risk off" rally with a vengeance, its decline accelerating in the last few minutes. At $93.72/barrel, September WTI oil is off nearly $5 in less than 3 hours. USO -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM

  • The market's fear gauge is starting to oscillate with bigger swings on more economic uncertainty...

    The market's fear gauge is starting to oscillate with bigger swings on more economic uncertainty after sitting passive for the last few months. The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) shot past 25 early before settling back, and is the 3rd most-traded option contract for the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONB

    Old National Bancorp (NYSE:ONB) posts an 11.9% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of...

    Old National Bancorp (NYSE:ONB) posts an 11.9% gain after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $108.8M (+11% Y/Y) and $0.18, beating a consensus of $103.7M and $0.16. The company's non-performing loans stood at $79.7M, down from $82.4M in Q2 2010. Net interest margin rose to 3.67%, from 3.40% in the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • INFN

    Reports of insider buying are driving up shares of Infinera (INFN +9.5%) today. Recent EDGAR...

    Reports of insider buying are driving up shares of Infinera (INFN +9.5%) today. Recent EDGAR filings show Chief Strategy Officer David Welch and CEO Tom Fallon each made purchases of their company's shares last week in the wake of the company's recent earnings statement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • GPN

    Bank card payments processor Heartland Payment Systems (HPY) is up 5.6% after reporting Q2...

    Bank card payments processor Heartland Payment Systems (HPY) is up 5.6% after reporting Q2 revenue and adjusted EPS of $122.2M (+6% Y/Y) and $0.31, compared with a consensus of $126.3M and $0.29. The company is raising its 2011 EPS forecast to $1.00-$1.04, above a $0.99 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • MMP

    Magellan Midstream (MMP +1.2%) is trading higher today after S&P raised its outlook on the...

    Magellan Midstream (MMP +1.2%) is trading higher today after S&P raised its outlook on the company to positive late Friday. The ratings company cites the oil distributor's growing asset base, stable cash flows and a strong governance structure for the upgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.1%) agrees to pay a $2.5M fine to the government to settle accusations the...

    Caterpillar (CAT +1.1%) agrees to pay a $2.5M fine to the government to settle accusations the firm breached the U.S. Clean Air Act with engines lacking the proper emission controls, effectively putting the investigation to rest. Shares of CAT stand as the leading gainer in the Dow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • FNFG

    Shares of First Niagara Bank (FNFG -4.5%) remain lower even after S&P affirms its BBB rating...

    Shares of First Niagara Bank (FNFG -4.5%) remain lower even after S&P affirms its BBB rating and stable outlook following the firm's announcement it will acquire 195 branches from HSBC (HBC). Fitch Ratings also weighed in with a BBB rating, citing the company's proven track record of integrating banks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • HCP

    Healthcare REITs with exposure to nursing-care homes are also taking a hit on Medicare's rate...

    Healthcare REITs with exposure to nursing-care homes are also taking a hit on Medicare's rate cut announcement. HCP -4.4%, HCN -6%, HR -2.4%, OHI -11.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • IRF

    JMP Securities lowers its rating on International Rectifier (IRF -2.9%) to Market Perform from...

    JMP Securities lowers its rating on International Rectifier (IRF -2.9%) to Market Perform from Outperform, and cuts FY12 EPS estimates to $2.15 from $2.42. The firm expects downward guidance on revenue from the chip-maker when it reports on August 17th due to diminished supply demands.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • HAE

    Medical device maker Haemonetics (HAE -7%) takes a hit as its FQ1 earnings miss the mark due to...

    Medical device maker Haemonetics (HAE -7%) takes a hit as its FQ1 earnings miss the mark due to a product recall. The company also reduces FY guidance, citing "significant headwinds" it faces over regulatory and economic concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • BCSI

    Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) is down 2.4% after Lazard's Ryan Hutchinson downgrades the...

    Blue Coat Systems (NASDAQ:BCSI) is down 2.4% after Lazard's Ryan Hutchinson downgrades the company to Netural. Hutchinson's channel checks suggest Blue Coat's integrated solutions for securing and optimizing the performance of Internet traffic aren't faring well. Competitor Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) plunged recently after reporting disappointing Q2 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • MCY

    Automotive insurance firm Mercury General (NYSE:MCY) rises 4.2% after reporting Q2 revenue and...

    Automotive insurance firm Mercury General (NYSE:MCY) rises 4.2% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $706.5M (+8% Y/Y) and $1.04, beating a consensus of $677.1M and $0.63. The company wrote $636.3M in net premiums, up 0.8% Y/Y. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM

  • It was nice while it lasted, as the stock market's opening rally evaporates after the miserable...

    It was nice while it lasted, as the stock market's opening rally evaporates after the miserable ISM manufacturing report. Dow now -68, or -0.6%, after opening up more than 100 points; S&P -0.7%, Nasdaq -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 6 Comments
  • ORBK

    Orbotech (NASDAQ:ORBK), a maker of electronics manufacturing equipment, is up 8.5% after...

    Orbotech (NASDAQ:ORBK), a maker of electronics manufacturing equipment, is up 8.5% after reporting Q2 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $153.4M (+6% Y/Y) and $0.56, compared with a consensus of $155.2M and $0.44. The company is raising its 2011 non-GAAP EPS guidance to $1.80-$1.85, up from $1.70-$1.78. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -2.5%) trades lower after Moody's reduced it to junk and put it on watch for...

    AK Steel (AKS -2.5%) trades lower after Moody's reduced it to junk and put it on watch for a downgrade late Friday. The ratings service cites challenges related to the steel industry's slow recovery and rising cost pressures in iron ore and coking coal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment

  • Things are disintegrating quickly in Europe, the Stoxx 50 -2.1% after being up 1.5% earlier....

    Things are disintegrating quickly in Europe, the Stoxx 50 -2.1% after being up 1.5% earlier. It's another day at the office for Italy, now -4.0%, after being up 1.5% this morning. Intraday swings of at least 2-3% have become the norm since the nation became the latest focus of EU debt issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYOU

    Chinese online game developer and operator Changyou (CYOU -6.4%) beats Q2 estimates...

    Chinese online game developer and operator Changyou (CYOU -6.4%) beats Q2 estimates across-the-board, but gives mixed guidance for Q3, saying revenues should be higher, but EPS will be lower than expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA -4.1%) shares slide on news that its promising oral MS drug failed its...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA -4.1%) shares slide on news that its promising oral MS drug failed its second late-stage clinical trial. The drug had been effective in an earlier study, so the new results were a surprise. Biogen's (BIIB +1.4%) MS pill has performed well in tests, and should take a leading position in the emerging market for oral MS drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • SUNH

    Shares of health-care providers tumble after Medicare announced late Friday that it will cut...

    Shares of health-care providers tumble after Medicare announced late Friday that it will cut payment rates to skilled nursing facilities by 11.1% next fiscal year. The decision adjusts for an "unexpected spike" in nursing-home payments this fiscal year. SUNH -54.3%, KND -25.5%, SKH -39.2%, FVE -8.5%, ENSG -16.9%, SRZ -2.9%, NHC -12%, AMED -2.3% (earlier).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • AWI

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -2.6%) opens lower as Q2 earnings jump 41% on improved sales and...

    Armstrong World Industries (AWI -2.6%) opens lower as Q2 earnings jump 41% on improved sales and margins, but most of the gains came on cost cutting rather than increased order volume. The flooring and building products maker ups the low end of its FY11 sales forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • AAL

    American Airlines parent company AMR agrees to extend agreements with its ticket distribution...

    American Airlines parent company AMR agrees to extend agreements with its ticket distribution service Travelport, suggesting the dispute may be nearing a resolution. AMR +2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Bank stocks (XLF +1.5%) look to be poised for a strong open in the wake of the debt ceiling...

    Bank stocks (XLF +1.5%) look to be poised for a strong open in the wake of the debt ceiling deal. The big four - Bank of America (BAC +3.2%), JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.7%), Citigroup (C +2.4%) and Wells Fargo (WFC +1.6%) - are all higher in premarket action.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • SUNH

    Shares of Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) freefall after U.S. regulators slash 2012 Medicare...

    Shares of Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) freefall after U.S. regulators slash 2012 Medicare payments to nursing home operators. Oppenheimer and Morgan Keegan chipped in with downgrades on the news. Shares -45% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • DELL

    EMC (EMC) receives a boost from Oppenheimer with an upgrade to Outperform from Perform and a new...

    EMC (EMC) receives a boost from Oppenheimer with an upgrade to Outperform from Perform and a new price target of $32. The firm still waits for the dust to settle on a legal battle stemming from the $4.5B purchase of Nortel patents by a consortium that includes EMC. Shares +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) is up 4.3% after announcing Merck (NYSE:MRK), its partner in...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) is up 4.3% after announcing Merck (NYSE:MRK), its partner in the development and distribution of its Ridaforolimus cancer-treatment drug, has submitted an application for the right to market Ridaforolimus within the EU. Ariad will receive a $25M payment from Merck in the event the application is approved. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • WIN

    In an effort to build out its network, Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) buys broadband provider Paetec...

    In an effort to build out its network, Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) buys broadband provider Paetec (NASDAQ:PAET) for around $2.3B by assuming $1.4B of Paetec's debt and purchasing the remainder in an $891M stock swap. The deal will not only add to Windstream's fiber-optic route structure, it also allows the company to use Paetec's tax benefits to offset future profits. WIN -1.4%, PAET +16% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • ELN

    Elan (NYSE:ELN) shares jump +4.6% premarket after Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) announces...

    Elan (NYSE:ELN) shares jump +4.6% premarket after Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) announces positive prescriber response for its AMPYRA treatment for MS patients. The drug is manufactured by Elan in a supply agreement with Acorda.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • SOHU

    More on Sohu's (NASDAQ:SOHU) Q2: Guides for Q3 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $225M-$230M and...

    More on Sohu's (NASDAQ:SOHU) Q2: Guides for Q3 revenue and non-GAAP EPS of $225M-$230M and $1.20-$1.25, beating a consensus of $206.4M and $1.19. Online advertising revenue +27% Y/Y in Q2; Sogou search engine revenue +252%; gaming revenue +31%; wireless revenue +5%. SOHU +0.9% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • RTN

    Raytheon (RTN +2.5%) gets upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Bernstein Research,...

    Raytheon (RTN +2.5%) gets upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Bernstein Research, which believes RTN's low stock price is unjustified and sees "stable" revenue and margin trajectories. RTN "is now the least expensive of the large defense primes on virtually every measure."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • RSH

    Goldman upgrades RadioShack (RSH +4.9%) to Conviction Buy from Neutral, saying it sees an...

    Goldman upgrades RadioShack (RSH +4.9%) to Conviction Buy from Neutral, saying it sees an attractive entry point and noting RadioShack's recent Verizon deal "broadens its market opportunity substantially, and should drive reacceleration in wireless sales trends, overall same-store sales growth, and earnings growth."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) +1.3% premarket, possibly getting the bounce off Barron's bullish call on...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) +1.3% premarket, possibly getting the bounce off Barron's bullish call on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • HSBC

    As part of its plan to save $2.5B-3.5B, HSBC (HBC +3.3%) is cutting 5,000 jobs and has...

    As part of its plan to save $2.5B-3.5B, HSBC (HBC +3.3%) is cutting 5,000 jobs and has "initiated more efficient business operating models for commercial banking, retail banking and wealth management." (PR) (see also)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 AM
  • HSBC

    HSBC (HBC): H1 pretax profit +3% Y/Y to $11.5B; net profit +35% to $8.93B; EPS of $0.51....

    HSBC (HBC): H1 pretax profit +3% Y/Y to $11.5B; net profit +35% to $8.93B; EPS of $0.51. Impairments -30% to $5.3B. Targeting $2.5B-3.5B of cost savings. Core Tier 1 capital ratio of 10.8%, up from 10.5%. Shares +3.4% in London. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 AM
